gaps.description: Behavior parity is defined in-repo and machine-checked by paritycheck output including OPEN_GAPS=0.
Composite/FIX/NVFIX and header/message parsing paths handle invalid ranges and malformed wire data without panics.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/... passes parser/builder coverage tests.

gaps.description: LogonParams.Timeout is enforced during logon ack wait.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/... includes logon-timeout coverage and passes.

gaps.description: File-backed stores use append/checkpoint persistence with crash-safe recovery semantics.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/... passes publish/bookmark store persistence tests.

gaps.description: Recovery ordering is deterministic: publish replay, resubscribe, retry/deferred callbacks.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/... passes HA and post-logon recovery behavior tests.

gaps.description: Pure-Go Kerberos compatibility authenticator is available through a dedicated package and existing Authenticator contract.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/... passes kerberos package tests.

gaps.description: CAPI SSL compatibility has stateful handle/context validation and deterministic error behavior.
gaps.pass_criteria: go test -count=1 ./amps/capi passes SSL compatibility tests.

gaps.description: Benchmark baseline and regression gate are available for hot-path operations.
gaps.pass_criteria: go run ./tools/perfgate validates benchmark deltas within threshold.

gaps.description: Parity acceptance and scope docs align with implemented behavior and gate commands.
gaps.pass_criteria: docs include gap register and parity acceptance workflow referencing machine gates.
